CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 1, 1941, pg. 21 reads: "Stan Williams' Remodelled Tavern Ranks With Hill's Best - Stanley Williams, well-known business man, has remodeled...tavern, near Wylie and ...offering his many patrons...the best equipped and...modern businesses in ...The remodelling and ren-... has been under way for...but is now practically completed. The upper left photo shows a group of patrons celebrating the grand reopening last Thursday.  The small inset photo shows the popular proprietor, Stanley Williams.  Then new unique front is shown in the upper right photograph.  This is one of the "modernistic" type and rates with the very best.  The lower picture shows, left to right, Mrs. Stanley Williams, J.W. Saunders, chef, and Gladys Lewis, waitress.-Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Three men wearing light colored jackets, and two women, one wearing waitress uniform, gathered behind bar of Stanley's Tavern for grand reopening
